title: Getting Started
text: vvtableau package provides interface interacting Tableau Server using Tableau REST API. vignette walk main functionalities package, demonstrating authenticate, retrieve information, perform various operations Tableau Server.
code: library(vvtableau)

title: Getting Started
text: begin, need authenticate establish connection Tableau Server. Use authenticate_server() function provide server URL, username, password. ’s example: authentication succeeded following system variables set: - TABLEAU_API_TOKEN - TABLEAU_API_USER_ID - TABLEAU_API_SITE_ID variables required order use Server methods.
code: authenticate_server(server = "https://tableau.server.com",                     username = "your_username",                     password = "your_password")

title: Getting Started
text: connected, can retrieve various information Tableau Server using provided functions. example retrieve jobs server:
code: get_server_jobs(base_url = "https://tableau.server.com",                             site_id = Sys.getenv("TABLEAU_API_SITE_ID"),                             token = Sys.getenv("TABLEAU_API_TOKEN"),                             page_size = 300)

title: Getting Started
text: vignette covered basic functionalities vvtableau package, including authentication, retrieving server information, publishing workbooks, managing users groups, downloading workbooks views. complete list functions parameters, please refer package documentation. Please note vignette serves brief introduction package capabilities. detailed instructions examples, consult package documentation explore individual function documentation. hope find vvtableau package helpful automating Tableau workflows enhancing Tableau Server experience!

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tomer Iwan. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Iwan T (2023). vvtableau: R Interface 'Tableau' Services. https://github.com/vusaverse/vvtableau, https://vusaverse.github.io/vvtableau/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {vvtableau: R Interface for 'Tableau' Services},   author = {Tomer Iwan},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/vusaverse/vvtableau, https://vusaverse.github.io/vvtableau/}, }

title: R Interface for Tableau Services
text: vvtableau package R interface interacting Tableau Server using Tableau REST API. provides convenient way automate Tableau tasks, publishing workbooks, refreshing data extracts, managing users groups, retrieving information server objects directly R. Additionally, includes functions download filtered views, workbooks, export different formats like PDF PowerPoint. Furthermore, methods included interact Tableau desktop. methods allow retrieve information workbooks change .

title: R Interface for Tableau Services
text: Authenticate establish connection Tableau Server. Check existence specific dashboard names. Download filtered views Tableau Server. Download workbooks Tableau Server various formats (PDF, PowerPoint). Retrieve information actions, folders, hierarchies, parameters, revisions, server applications, datasources, groups, locations, projects, refresh tasks, schedules, users, views, workbooks. Retrieve Tableau data source information. Manage variables variable folders. Retrieve workbook IDs tabs.

title: R Interface for Tableau Services
text: can install tableauR package GitHub using devtools package: package also available CRAN:
code: devtools::install_github("vusaverse/vvtableau") library(vvtableau) install.packages("vvtableau") library(vvtableau)

title: R Interface for Tableau Services
text: Contributions vvtableau welcome! encounter bugs, feature requests, like contribute code improvements, please open issue submit pull request GitHub repository.

what: Authenticate on the Tableau server. — authenticate_server
title: Authenticate on the Tableau server. — authenticate_server
text: Authenticates users sets system variables. necessary order run Tableau REST Api methods.

title: Authenticate on the Tableau server. — authenticate_server
code: authenticate_server(username, password, base_url, api_version = 3.4)

title: Authenticate on the Tableau server. — authenticate_server
text: username username Tableau server. password password Tableau server. base_url base url Tableau server. api_version api version.

title: Authenticate on the Tableau server. — authenticate_server
Authenticate on the Tableau server. — authenticate_server
code: if (FALSE) { # Authenticate on the Tableau server authenticate_server(username = "your_username",                     password = "your_password",                     base_url = "https://tableau.server.com",                     api_version = 3.4) } # Check the set system variables Sys.getenv("TABLEAU_API_TOKEN") #> [1] "" Sys.getenv("TABLEAU_API_SITE_ID") #> [1] "" Sys.getenv("TABLEAU_API_USER_ID") #> [1] ""

code: download_workbooks_server(   base_url,   api_version = 3.4,   site_id,   token,   workbook_id,   path_to_save,   include_extract = FALSE )

title: Download workbook from Tableau Server — download_workbooks_server
text: base_url url Tableau Server. api_version api version; default set 3.4 site_id site id Tableau server access. token access token Tableau Rest API. workbook_id identifier workbook. path_to_save write .twb .twbx file . include_extract Whether include extract file. Deafult set FALES.

title: Download workbook from Tableau Server — download_workbooks_server
Download workbook from Tableau Server — download_workbooks_server
code: if (FALSE) { # Download workbook from Tableau Server download_workbooks_server(base_url = "https://tableau.server.com",                           api_version = 3.4,                           site_id = "your_site_id",                           token = "your_access_token",                           workbook_id = "your_workbook_id",                           path_to_save = "path/to/save/workbook.twb",                           include_extract = FALSE) }
